tables.name: OEPAirFlowTask
tables.description: Diagnostic logs for AirFlow task execution having task name, task details.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Timestamp (in UTC) when the log was created.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Logs generated as a result of operations executed using OAK APIs are grouped into categories. Categories in OAK are logical groupings based on the data source.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation name for which the log entry was created.

columns.name: LogLevel
columns.description: Log Level of the log - Info/Debug/Warning/Error

columns.name: DagName
columns.description: Name of the DAG run - as per Airflow's list of DAGs present

columns.name: DagTaskName
columns.description: Name of Task executed in Airflow DAG.

columns.name: RunId
columns.description: To identify the particular DAG run which generated the log

columns.name: CodePath
columns.description: The task inside the DAG run which generated the log

columns.name: TryNumber
columns.description: Retry count number for self managed airflow

columns.name: Content
columns.description: Log details as a result of operation performed.

columns.name: AdditionalLogContent
columns.description: Additional log content, if there is any more info that needs to be populated

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The region of the resource emitting the event.

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: Unique identifier to be used to correlate logs, when available.

tables.name: OEPElasticOperator
tables.description: Diagnostic logs for elastic operator. Elastic operator manages all the elasticsearch clusters in the oak instance. These logs can be helpful in identifing what operations are performed by the operator on the cluster. It could be upgrades, reconciliation, resource update etc.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Timestamp (in UTC) when the log was created.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Logs generated as a result of operations executed using OAK APIs are grouped into categories. Categories in OAK are logical groupings based on the data source.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation name for which the log entry was created.

columns.name: Content
columns.description: Log details as a result of operation performed.

columns.name: Namespace
columns.description: Namespace from which logs were generated, represents the data partition.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The region of the resource emitting the event.

tables.name: OEPElasticsearch
tables.description: Diagnostic logs for Elasticsearch cluster. It could be slow logs, server logs or deprecation logs.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Timestamp (in UTC) when the log was created.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Logs generated as a result of operations executed using OAK APIs are grouped into categories. Categories in OAK are logical groupings based on the data source.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation name for which the log entry was created.

columns.name: Content
columns.description: Log details as a result of operation performed.

columns.name: Namespace
columns.description: Namespace from which logs were generated, represents the data partition.

columns.name: PodName
columns.description: Elasticsearch pod name.

columns.name: Duration
columns.description: Time taken for performing the operation. Value is taken from 'took' property in Elasticsearch cluster as string, like '1.3ms', '478.9micros' etc.

columns.name: TotalHits
columns.description: Total number of hits for a search operation. For example, value can be '3 hits' for 3 hits, '-1' for no hits, or 'null' if it is not a search slow log.

columns.name: Source
columns.description: Source responsible for the log. It could be a search query or a record to be indexed in case of slow logs and null otherwise.

columns.name: Type
columns.description: Type of log. Can be index_search_slowlog, index_indexing_slowlog, server, deprecation etc.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The region of the resource emitting the event.

tables.name: OEPAuditLogs
tables.description: Audit Logs for Microsoft Energy Data Services.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Timestamp (UTC) when the log was created.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Logs generated as a result of operations executed using OAK APIs are grouped into categories. Categories in OAK are logical groupings based on the data source.

columns.name: Location
columns.description: The region of the resource emitting the event.

columns.name: ServiceName
columns.description: The name of service which is emitting the event.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The operation name for which the log entry was created.

columns.name: DataPartitionId
columns.description: Represents the data partition ID.

columns.name: Action
columns.description: Action performed,which can be CREATE,PUBLISH,UPDATE,DELETE,READ and JOB_RUN.

columns.name: ActionId
columns.description: ID of the action performed.

columns.name: Puid
columns.description: The client ID.

columns.name: ResultType
columns.description: Result of the REST API request.

columns.name: OperationDescription
columns.description: Description of operation that was performed.

columns.name: RequestId
columns.description: The request ID uniquely identify the request made to Microsoft Energy Data Services for an operation.

columns.name: Message
columns.description: The message about the operation.

tables.description: Contains logs for HTTP requests & responses for the Indexer Service API, in OSDU Data Platform, and Microsoft Energy Data Services. The Indexer service, indexes the metadata store to support search. The indexer service will automatically take items that are newly added to storage and index the attributes from the schema associated with the kind attribute.

queries.displayName: DAG type vs DAG runs summary statitics
queries.description: Number of DAG runs of each type of DAG type in the given time range

queries.displayName: Correlation IDs of all DAG runs
queries.description: Correlation IDs of all the DAG runs that have occurred in the time range (for all DAG types)
Retrieves logs for a particular AirFlow DAG run given the correlationId and time range.

queries.displayName: Error logs of a DAG run
queries.description: Retrieves error logs for a particular AirFlow DAG run given the correlationId and time range.

Categorize log messages by HTTP response codes, filters out logs without a response code, and summarizes the count of each response code over a specified time granularity. It then renders a column chart for visualization.

queries.displayName: Analyzing User Activity in Storage Logs
queries.description: Extract UserId values, filters logs to include only those with a UserId and belonging to the StorageLogs category, and checks for specific HTTP methods. It then summarizes the count of logs per user over daily intervals and renders a pie chart for visualization.
This KQL query summarizes the count of logs by category over the last 24 hours and renders a pie chart for visualization.
Extract UserId values, filters out logs without a UserId, and summarizes the count of logs per user over the last 24 hours. Renders a pie chart to visualize user activity.

Filters logs to the last 30 minutes, categorizes them by HTTP response codes, and counts the total number of logs and errors. It then summarizes these counts in 15-second intervals and renders a timechart for visual analysis.
Ensures that each log entry has a CorrelationId. If the CorrelationId is missing, it extracts the value from the Message field using a regular expression.

queries.displayName: Extracting and Categorizing HTTP Response Codes
queries.description: Categorize log messages based on HTTP response codes. It extends the log data with a new column called ResponseCode and displays only relevant fields.
